intro: Draba popocatepetlensis, commonly known as the Popocatépetl Draba, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
